titleStmt.title: A reply to a certain pamphlet written by an vnknowing and vnknown author, vvho takes upon him to answer the true and perfect narrative of the several proceedings concerning the Lord Craven. Published to undeceive those whom that nameless person hath so grosly abused with his falsities, misrecitals, short recitals, and inventions (almost) in every page of his pamphlet.

A reply to a certain pamphlet written by an vnknowing and vnknown author, vvho takes upon him to answer the true and perfect narrative of the several proceedings concerning the Lord Craven. Published to undeceive those whom that nameless person hath so grosly abused with his falsities, misrecitals, short recitals, and inventions (almost) in every page of his pamphlet.

notesStmt.note: A reply to: The Lord Craven's case, as to the confiscation and sale of his estate by judgment of Parlament.
Reproductions of the original in the British Library.
